item.title: new oc
item.description: Why OC again? Upgraded to latest BIOS version for B550M Mortar Wifi: 7C94v1B RAM OC was unstable since first overclocked last year Upgraded to Windows 11 (fresh install) RAM Kit Used (CJR - Dual Rank 2x16GB) G.Skill Ripjaws V 32 GB (2 x 16 GB) DDR4-3600 CL16 Memory Stable 3800MHz Setup 3800MHz/1900FCLK 16-21-16-21-36-56 CAS Latency 1.42v DRAM 1.1125v SOC 0.95v VDDP 1.01v IOD/CCD RAM Test Passed GeForce RTX 3070 XC3 BLACK OC +120 clock - 1620 MHz +1000 vram - 2000 MHz Timespy Loop Stress Test - Sensors AIDA Timespy

item.title: 853.77 Cats Per Second
item.description: Fresh Setup Overview Purpose for the build is to work with CUDA for data science seperate from my gaming machine in compact build as I have limited desk space. Parts List PCPartPicker Part List Type Item Price CPU Intel Core i5-10400F 2.9 GHz 6-Core Processor Purchased For $209.99 CPU Cooler Deepcool GAMMAXX 400 V2 64.5 CFM CPU Cooler Purchased For $25.54 Motherboard ASRock B560M-ITX/ac Mini ITX LGA1200 Motherboard Purchased For $130.

item.title: 3800mhz cjr ram kit oc
item.description: RAM OC Guide Referenced DDR4 OC Guide RAM Kit Used (CJR) G.Skill Ripjaws V 32 GB (2 x 16 GB) DDR4-3600 CL16 Memory Stable 3800MHz Setup 3800MHz/1900FCLK 16-18-20-38 CAS Latency 1.42v DRAM 1.1125v SOC 1.025 VDDP 1v IOD/CCD Conclusion Lots of trial and error to get stable ram oc B-Die speeds at CJR prices Final Timings RAM Test Passed Benchmarks AIDA Timespy Before RAM OC 14,573 Score After RAM OC 14,800 Score

item.title: 1440p pc upgrade
item.description: changes: Changes to my main build. Sold the 2060KO GPU, 2x sticks of RAM, 24" MSI 1080p 144hz curved Monitor and EVGA GQ 650 Watt PSU. Upgraded to 27" LG 27GL83A-B 1440p 144hz monitor, Corsair RM850x PSU, EVGA XC3 3070 GPU. New GPU did +130/+1400 vcore/vram OC. Changed 3900x manual OC to PBO level 3 OC. I am also thinking of possibly replacing the noctua fan with chromax version. Memory stable at 3800mhz.

item.title: pfsense firewall hardware upgrade
item.description: What? pfSense is a free firewall that you can install on any pc. I have been using it for many years. Why Upgrade? I upgraded to gigabit fiber at home. My ISP provides direct sfp handoff without need for a ONT. I can bypass need for ISP provided router and directly connect pfSense to the internet. I already own motherboard (low powered intel atom cpu embedded board), storage, RAM and DC to DC PSU.

item.title: new pc
item.description: i build a new personal pc specs: CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X CPU Cooler: Noctua NH-D15S Motherboard: MSI MAG B550M Mortar Memory: G.Skill Ripjaws V 64 GB (4 x 16 GB) DDR4-3600 CL16 Storage: 2 x Western Digital SN750 1 TB M.2-2280 NVME SSD (in RAID0) Graphics Card: EVGA GeForce RTX 2060 6 GB KO Case: Cooler Master MasterBox NR400 Power Supply: EVGA 650W 80+ Gold PSU Custom Cables: CableMod M​odFlex Bas​ic Cable E​xtension K​it (Black) Case Fans: 3 x Arctic P12 RGB: Phanteks Neon more info: build + pics + overclock notes
